In Short
Luis Enrique parted ways with Spain on Thursday
Gavi thanked Enrique for trusting him
The young midfielder said that the players will always be grateful towards Enrique
By India Today Web Desk: Spain midfielder Gavi has penned an emotional message on social media, thanking former Spain manager Luis Enrique for the faith he showed in him.
Enrique parted ways with the former World Champions on Thursday, a day after their Round of 16 loss to Morocco on Tuesday.
The Spain football federation went on to name the country's U-21 team coach, Luis de la Fuente, as the replacement for the former Barcelona tactician.

By India Today Web Desk: Spain midfielder Gavi has penned an emotional message on social media, thanking former Spain manager Luis Enrique for the faith he showed in him.
The Spain football federation went on to name the country's U-21 team coach, Luis de la Fuente, as the replacement for the former Barcelona tactician.
"The RFEF has chosen Luis de la Fuente as the new (Spain) coach," RFEF said in a statement.
"Both the RFEF president Luis Rubiales and sports director, Jose Francisco Molina have informed Luis Enrique of the decision.
The RFEF would like to thank Luis Enrique and his entire coaching staff for the work done in the last few years."
Gavi decided to pen a special message for the departing Spain manager on Instagram and thanked him for trusting him with a spot in the national team.

He is the fourth manager to get sacked after their teams were eliminated at the World Cup in Qatar.

Dec. 8 (UPI) -- Spain fired manager Luis Enrique after an upset loss to Morocco at the 2022 World Cup, the Spanish Football Federation announced Thursday.
"The [Spanish Football Federation] would like to thank Luis Enrique and his entire coaching staff at the helm of the absolute national team in recent years," the Spanish Football Federation said.
Enrique, 52, previously coached at Roma, Celta and Barcelona.
He joined Spain as a coach in 2018, but left briefly for personal reasons.
Spain then outshot Morocco 13-6, but put just one attempt on frame in the Round of 16.

"The [federation] has chosen Luis de la Fuente as the new national coach.
